quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Team and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, president. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which team won the second Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Green Bay Packers

questions.question: In which city was Michael Jordans second professional team based?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Who was Elizabeth Taylors second husband?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Wilding

questions.question: What does lacrimation mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shedding Tears

questions.question: What is the second book of the Bible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Exodus

questions.question: What was the second war fought by the USA?

options.text: The War against the Barbary Pirates

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The War of 1812

questions.question: What role does the carburetor have in the engine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mixing air and fuel

questions.question: Who was the second US President  to face impeachment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Clinton

questions.question: Who was Frank Sinatras second wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ava Gardner

questions.question: What was the second  song played on MTV?

options.text: Hit Me With Your Best Shot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You Better Run

questions.question: Which of these stories was written by the Brothers Grimm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Frog Prince

questions.question: Which team won the second World Series between the National League and the American League?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Giants

questions.question: What was Elvis Presleys second number 1hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Be Cruel

questions.question: Dry air consists mostly of what gas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nitrogen

questions.question: Who was the second host of the Tonight Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Paar

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Letter and Usa
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leviathan, books. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is generally considered to be the second longest symphony?

options.text: Mahlers Symphony No. 3 in D minor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shostakovitchs Leningrad Symphony

questions.question: Which of these is not a quote by Groucho Marx?

options.text: I have a memory like an elephant. In fact elephants often consult me.
The husband who wants a  perfect marriage should keep his mouth shut and his checkbook open.
I was married by a judge. I should have asked for the jury.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I have a memory like an elephant. In fact elephants often consult me.

questions.question: Who is Hiroo Onoda?

options.text: The last Japanese casualty from World War II
This is the real name of Tojo.
The Japanese fisherman who first sees Godzilla in the movie of the same name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The last Japanese casualty from World War II

questions.question: This drink was invented for a party given by Winston Churchills mother.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Manhattan

questions.question: The letter J is the last letter added to the Latin alphabet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which Biblical prophet, mentioned in two books of the Bible, was swallowed by a great leviathan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonah

questions.question: By act of Congress, this is the official alcoholic spirit of the USA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bourbon

questions.question: What is lethologica?

options.text: Any  word used incorrectly in a sentence.
A physical disease in which the patient does not have enough energy to speak
A psychological disease first identified as a serious condition by Carl Jung
A religious practice involving saying certain Biblical names to counter a sin.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A psychological disease first identified as a serious condition by Carl Jung

questions.question: Which of these is covered by the second amendment to the US Constitution?

options.text: the right to bear arms in order to maintain a militia
the right to not have soldiers living in our houses
the right to a fair and speedy trial

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the right to bear arms in order to maintain a militia

questions.question: Who was the second Republican US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses Grant

questions.question: The USA has an extensive Interstate Highway System. What five state capitals are NOT directly served by this system?

options.text: Juneau, Dover, Carson City, Honolulu, Pierre
Juneau, Honolulu, Jefferson City, Carson City, Pierre
Juneau, Honolulu, Salem, Columbia,  Salt Lake City
Juneau, Dover, Jefferson City, Pierre, Carson City

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juneau, Dover, Jefferson City, Pierre, Carson City

questions.question: What is Belle Fourche?

options.text: The  geographic center of the United States.
A new dessert created on TV, which contains three types of chocolate, strawberries, and  cranberry marmalade.
The resort voted Number One Vacation Destination  by Forbes Magazine
A very upscale suburb of Paris in which the average house goes for 3,450,000 Euros

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The  geographic center of the United States.

questions.question: What is true  about  music compact discs?

options.text: Americas Greatest Hits is the number one selling CD in the USA.
The hole is the exact size of the Dutch coin called dubbeltje.
The patent behind the compact disc is co-owned by Dick Clark.
Glen Campbells Greatest Hits was the first music CD in the USA.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The hole is the exact size of the Dutch coin called dubbeltje.

questions.question: Which was the second motion picture  to win the Oscar for Best Movie?

options.text: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Broadway Melody

questions.question: Which best defines the word Sanhedrin?

options.text: The condition of being without mental faculties
The religious book on which the Jain religion is based
The ancient spice used in Egypt to counter bad omens
The court of 23  judges biblically required to be present in every city

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The court of 23  judges biblically required to be present in every city

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Jimmy and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, jesse, figures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the poem in which these nonsense words are used: chortled, vorpal, galumphing, and frabjous?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jabberwocky

questions.question: The most garbage collecting volunteers gathered in this US state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: California

questions.question: This was the first country that starts with the letter J to join the United Nations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jordan

questions.question: This sea animal is found in the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian Oceans but is most numerous off Hawaii and Australia. Although it usually weighs about .8 Kg, some individuals actually weigh 3 Kg (over 6.7 pounds.) This animal is blue on top and silver on bottom, often with a blue stripe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: jack-ass fish

questions.question: He won the 2000 Nobel Peace Prize for his work promoting peace and democracy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Dae Jung

questions.question: What was Christine Jorgensen most famous for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: transgender surgery

questions.question: His first name was Jimmy and he was a great defensive back for the San Francisco 49ers from 1961 -1976. He is in the Pro Football Hall of Fame. His brother, Rafer, is more famous as an athlete and as a  part-time special bodyguard. What  is Jimmy and Rafers last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnson

questions.question: It is one of the oldest religions. Most of its followers live in India, where it began. Adherents believe that each individual is responsible for his/her actions. They believe that each living thing has an eternal soul. What is this religion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jainism

questions.question: WWII is undoubtedly the bloodiest war. This is the number of fatalities it caused.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 56.4 million

questions.question: This psychiatrist, born in Switzerland in 1875, was one of the founders of analytic psychology.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Gustav Jung

questions.question: This great boxer, known as the Galveston Giant, was the worlds Heavyweight Champion from 1908-1915.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Johnson

questions.question: He was called Big Train. He was the first baseball player whose last name began with a J to be elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Johnson

questions.question: Who killed Jesse James, one of the legendary figures of the Wild West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Ford

questions.question: They were a group of landed nobility in Prussia  and Eastern Germany. Their name comes from the German for young lord. They formed several aristocratic political groups in Germany.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Junkers

questions.question: In the USA we often see commercials for Subway sandwiches. They usually feature a man who went  from 425 pounds to 190 pounds because of a diet  based on Subways menu. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jared Fogel

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: World and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, douglas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The fastest time to eat this number of mince pies is 1 min : 52.67 seconds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Who was the fourth US president?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: This country has the highest income tax rate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

questions.question: What is the fourth estate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the press

questions.question: This is the largest employer in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indian Railways

questions.question: The largest burger weighed this much.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6,040 pounds (2,740 kg)

questions.question: The largest gay and lesbian rights march took place in the capital of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The US

questions.question: What is referred to by the term fourth world (in contrast to the better-known terms first world, second world and third world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: disenfranchised societies

questions.question: What is referred to as the fourth dimension?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: time

questions.question: This man is the highest earning fashion designer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Armani

questions.question: China is the most populous nation in the world. India is second, and the USA is third. What is the fourth most populous nation in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indonesia

questions.question: What is the fourth amendment to the US Constitution?

options.text: The right to not be subject to self incrimination
The right to not be subject to unreasonable searches and seizures
The right to not be subject to the quartering of soldiers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The right to not be subject to unreasonable searches and seizures

questions.question: The largest consumption of cigarettes belongs to this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: What book did author Douglas Adams describe as the fourth book in the Hitchhiker trilogy?

options.text: So Long, and Thanks For All the Fish
The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: So Long, and Thanks For All the Fish

questions.question: This country is the leader in beer consumption (per capita).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czech Republic

quizzes.title: History Quiz: China and Area
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, deaths, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Yellow River in China is prone to flooding.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What European country was affected the worst by the European Heat Wave of 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Which river in China caused a flood of mammoth proportions in 1931?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: What is the fourth largest nation in the world in area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Which of the following volcanoes caused the most deaths?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Tambora

questions.question: What is the fourth largest city in Canada (after Toronto, Montreal and Vancouver), as measured by metropolitan area according to 2006 estimates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ottawa

questions.question: What state was affected by the most powerful earthquake recorded in U.S. history prior to 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alaska

questions.question: We all know that New York, Los Angeles and Chicago are the three largest cities in the USA. What is the fourth largest city in the USA, as measured by metropolitan area (SMSA) according to 2006 US Census Bureau estimates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas-Fort Worth

questions.question: The Indian Ocean Earthquake of 2004 did not spark a tsunami.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What nation won the fourth World Cup (of football/soccer) in 1950?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uruguay

questions.question: The Bhola Cyclone of 1970 destroyed much of Pakistan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Galveston, Indiana was the site of a deadly tornado in 1900.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the fourth baseball player to hit 600 home runs in the US major leagues (Babe Ruth, of course, was the first)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Bonds

questions.question: What part of the U.S. was hit by the North American Storm Complex of 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East

questions.question: Where is the Louisiana Museum of Modern Art?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: City and Mascot
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, moulton, heisman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: For what is Scottish Sir James Dewar famous?

options.text: Writng the screenplay to The 39 Steps.
Standardizing the method to produce Scotch whiskey.
Exporting the first Scotch whiskey to the USA.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inventing the vacuum flask.

questions.question: Bernard Webb was a pseudonym used by which famous musician and songwriter?

options.text: none of these  three answers is  correct

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: Michelangelos statue of David is housed in what city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florence

questions.question: In 1975 Archie Griffin became the first two-time Heisman Trophy Winner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Can you name the singer who had a big music hit with Mr. Bojangles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Clyde Crosby

questions.question: In which TV series did American rapper Ice-T make his television debut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Players

questions.question: Which of the following was not a member of the band Lynryd Skynyrd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Farrar

questions.question: Ketchikan, Alaska holds what distinction?

options.text: the highest ratio of males to females of any American city
the highest amount of snow fall in an American city
the highest number of days of precipitation for any American city
the highest zip code for an American city

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the highest zip code for an American city

questions.question: Where did Chicago Bears defensive lineman, William Fridge Perry, play college football?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clemson

questions.question: What is the mascot of the University of California at Irvine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anteater

questions.question: William Moulton Marston was the psychologist who invented the polygraph or lie detector. What else did he create?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wonder Woman

questions.question: The Muppet Show was banned in Saudi Arabia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where is the only Christopher Wren building in the Western Hemisphere?

options.text: in The College of William and Mary

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in The College of William and Mary

questions.question: This became the longest running Broadway play on 9 January, 2006 .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phantom of the Opera

questions.question: The town of Juarez, Mexico is located next to what U.S. city?
